trans-unit.source: Represents a cell that contains a link.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell> class is a specialized type of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> used to display links.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn> is the column type specialized to hold cells of this type.
By default, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.CellTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is initialized to a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell>.

To pattern the cells within a column after an existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell>, set the column's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.CellTemplate%2A> property to the cell to use as a pattern.
The cell-related properties of the column are wrappers for the similarly-named properties of the template cell.
Changing the property values of the template cell will affect only cells based on the template that are added after the change.
Changing the cell-related property values of the column, however, will update the template cell and all other cells in the column, and refresh the column display if necessary.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the color used to display an active link.

Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.ActiveLinkColor%2A> property of the owning column also sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.ActiveLinkColor%2A> property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display.
To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the color used to display a link that is being selected.
The default value is the user's Internet Explorer setting for the color of links in the hover state.
Creates an exact copy of this cell.
Override the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.Clone%2A> method whenever you derive from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell> and add new properties to the derived class.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the cloned <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell"></xref>.
Creates a new accessible object for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell"></xref>.

If you do not explicitly call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.CreateAccessibilityInstance%2A> method, it will be called when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.DataGridViewLinkCellAccessibleObject> property is referenced.
To get or set <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.AccessibilityObject%2A>, you must add a reference to the `Accessibility` assembly installed with the .NET Framework.
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.DataGridViewLinkCellAccessibleObject"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell"></xref>.
Gets the type of the cell's hosted editing control.
As implemented in this class, this property always returns `null` because a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell> cannot be edited.
Always `null`.
Gets the display <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of the cell value.
The display <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of the cell value.
Returns the bounding rectangle that encloses the cell's content area, which is calculated using the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> and cell style.
The graphics context for the cell.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> to be applied to the cell.
The index of the cell's parent row.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that bounds the cell's contents.
Returns the bounding rectangle that encloses the cell's error icon, if one is displayed.
The graphics context for the cell.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> to be applied to the cell.
The index of the cell's parent row.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that bounds the cell's error icon, if one is displayed; otherwise, <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.Empty"></xref>.
Calculates the preferred size, in pixels, of the cell.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> that represents the style of the cell.
The zero-based row index of the cell.
The cell's maximum allowable size.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that represents the preferred size, in pixels, of the cell.
Gets the value of the cell.
The index of the cell's parent row.
The value contained in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref>.
Indicates whether the row containing the cell will be unshared when a key is released and the cell has focus.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.KeyUpUnsharesRow%2A> is called just before <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.OnKeyUp%2A>.
It must return `true` if the call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.OnKeyUp%2A> has the effect of unsharing the row containing the cell.
It should return `false` otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs"></xref> that contains data about the key press.
The index of the row containing the cell.

`true` if the SPACE key was released, the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.TrackVisitedState"></xref> property is `true`, the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.LinkVisited"></xref> property is `false`, and the CTRL, ALT, and SHIFT keys are not pressed; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that represents the behavior of a link.

Examples of link behavior include whether the link always displays an underline or the link only displays an underline when the mouse pointer moves over it, and whether a double click or a single click activates a link.

Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.LinkBehavior%2A> property of the owning column also sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.LinkBehavior%2A> property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display.
To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LinkBehavior"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LinkBehavior.SystemDefault"></xref>.
The specified value when setting this property is not a valid <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LinkBehavior"></xref> value.
Gets or sets the color used to display an inactive and unvisited link.

Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.LinkColor%2A> property of the owning column also sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.LinkColor%2A> property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display.
To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the color used to initially display a link.
The default value is the user's Internet Explorer setting for the link color.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the link was visited.

When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.TrackVisitedState%2A> property is set to `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.LinkVisited%2A> property is automatically set when the link is visited.
A link is visited if it has been activated by selecting it with the mouse or keyboard.
`true` if the link has been visited; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Indicates whether the row containing the cell will be unshared when the mouse button is pressed while the pointer is over the cell.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.MouseDownUnsharesRow%2A> is called just before <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.OnMouseDown%2A>.
It must return `true` if the call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.OnMouseDown%2A> has the effect of unsharing the row containing the cell.
It should return `false` otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains data about the mouse click.
`true` if the mouse pointer is over the link; otherwise, `false`.
Indicates whether the row containing the cell will be unshared when the mouse pointer leaves the cell.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.MouseLeaveUnsharesRow%2A> is called just before <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.OnMouseLeave%2A>.

<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.MouseLeaveUnsharesRow%2A> must return `true` if the call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.OnMouseLeave%2A> has the effect of unsharing the row containing the cell.
It should return `false` otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
The index of the row containing the cell.
`true` if the link displayed by the cell is not in the normal state; otherwise, `false`.
Indicates whether the row containing the cell will be unshared when the mouse pointer moves over the cell.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.MouseMoveUnsharesRow%2A> method is called just before the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.OnMouseMove%2A> method.
It must return `true` if the call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.OnMouseMove%2A> has the effect of unsharing the row containing the cell.
It should return `false` otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains data about the mouse click.
`true` if the mouse pointer is over the link and the link is has not yet changed color to reflect the hover state; otherwise, `false`.
Indicates whether the row containing the cell will be unshared when the mouse button is released while the pointer is over the cell.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.MouseUpUnsharesRow%2A> is called just before <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.OnMouseUp%2A>.
It must return `true` if the call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.OnMouseUp%2A> has the effect of unsharing the row containing the cell.
It should return `false` otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains data about the mouse click.
`true` if the mouse pointer is over the link; otherwise, `false`.
Called when a character key is released while the focus is on a cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
The index of the cell's parent row.
Called when the user holds down a mouse button while the pointer is on a cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Called when the mouse pointer leaves the cell.
The index of the cell's parent row.
Called when the mouse pointer moves within a cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Called when the user releases a mouse button while the pointer is on a cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Paints the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to paint the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the area of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> that needs to be repainted.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that contains the bounds of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> that is being painted.
The row index of the cell that is being painted.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values that specifies the state of the cell.
The data of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> that is being painted.
The formatted data of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> that is being painted.
An error message that is associated with the cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> that contains formatting and style information about the cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewAdvancedBorderStyle"></xref> that contains border styles for the cell that is being painted.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewPaintParts"></xref> values that specifies which parts of the cell need to be painted.
Returns a string that describes the current object.
A string that represents the current object.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the link changes color when it is visited.
When `false`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.LinkVisited%2A> property will not be automatically set to `true` when visited.

Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.TrackVisitedState%2A> property of the owning column also sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.TrackVisitedState%2A> property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display.
To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.
`true` if the link changes color when it is selected; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the column <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.Text"></xref> property value is displayed as the link text.

Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.UseColumnTextForLinkValue%2A> property of the owning column also sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.UseColumnTextForLinkValue%2A> property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display.
To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.

`true` if the column <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.Text"></xref> property value is displayed as the link text; `false` if the cell <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.FormattedValue"></xref> property value is displayed as the link text.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets the data type of the values in the cell.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> representing the data type of the value in the cell.
Gets or sets the color used to display a link that has been previously visited.

Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.VisitedLinkColor%2A> property of the owning column also sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.VisitedLinkColor%2A> property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display.
To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the color used to display a link that has been visited.
The default value is the user's Internet Explorer setting for the visited link color.
